explanation: The original code sorted the list s in ascending order (s.sort()) but then printed the first k elements. If the intention was to output the top k items in descending order, the sort direction was wrong. I fixed the single incorrect line by sorting in reverse order (s.sort(reverse=True)), which returns the largest items first so the loop printing s[0]..s[k-1] yields the top k elements.
fixed_code:
n, k = map(int, input().split())
s = [input() for _ in range(n)]
s.sort(reverse=True)
for i in range(k):
  print(s[i])
